sentences.en: But as matter spirals toward a black hole, some of it is blown away by the heat and light of the quasar.
sentences.cn: 但是随着物质盘旋飞向一个黑洞，它的一部分会被这个类星体的热量和光吹走。

sentences.en: But scientists have now found a quasar that's apparently churning out new stars in the absence of a host galaxy.
sentences.cn: 但是现在科学家们发现，一颗没有挂靠主星系的类星体显然在大量地制造出新恒星。

sentences.en: Therefore , quasar absorption lines cosmological probes of formation and evolution of galaxies.
sentences.cn: 对类星体吸收线的研究将有助于我们了解星系的形成和演化.

sentences.en: They do so by combining quasar spectra with numerical simulations of structure formation.
sentences.cn: 他们的做法是将类星体光谱和结构形成的数值模拟结果结合在一起.

sentences.en: This quasar was the only one without a known host galaxy.
sentences.cn: 这个类星体似乎无依无傍，不在任何一个星系当中。

sentences.en: Within a few million years, both quasar and galaxy will have merged.
sentences.cn: 在几百万年的时间里，类星体和伴星系将会合并在一起。

trans.tran_cn: [天]类星体，类星射电源，恒星状球体
trans.tran_en: an object in space that is similar to a star and that shines very brightly
